description: The course provides basic industrial hygiene knowledge for safety, health and environment protection practitioners. It will review the chemical, physical and biological and ergonomic hazards found in the workplace and their potential effect on human health, including an introduction to toxicology. The mechanism for exposure to the hazards and methods of estimation of employee exposures will be outlined. Employee exposure monitoring, sample analysis and data analysis will be discussed. The control of hazards and exposure in the workplace by inherently health analysis, engineering, personnel controls and personal protective clothing will be discussed.
title: Fundamentals in Industrial Hygiene
